item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
wontfix:

There are very differing opinions on this, but there seems to be a slight lean towards the idea that people shouldn't expect to be able to split a page in the middle of an open tag and have it validate. Re-open if you have a good argument to the contrary and we'll resume discussion.

item.title: Ticket #1772 (Massive Code Cleanup: template-functions-post.php) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Part IV of my Emmy-winning series, "Massive Code Cleanup."

This time, the target is template-functions-post.php, which wraps up the template-functions-* section of wp-includes.

As before, the bulk of the work consists of:

  • spaces to tabs
  • two newlines between functions
  • brackets removed for one-line if ()s
  • \t\n => \n
  • [space]\n => \n
  • \t[space] => \t
  • no cramming two lines into one.
  • if/else bracket tab matching
  • foreach : endforeach; and if : else; are for front-of-house code only
  • clean spacing for if, foreach, and for: if ( $condition ) {
  • if ( $something == 'value' ) => if ( 'value' == $something ) as per coding guidelines

item.title: Ticket #1770 (Collapsing tree-view functionality in Page Management tool) created
item.author: mike.matz@…
item.description: There should be some form of pagination in this tool -- ideally a tree view structure that by default collapses all branches of the tree. It is difficult to navigate within this tool when working on sites that have hundreds of pages.

item.title: Ticket #1769 (Don't ping on import) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: I imported my old blogspot blog into a new WP blog and experienced lots of hanging connections in the backend. I debugged it and it appears that WordPress is trying to ping all the URLs in the posts I imported. URLs shouldn't be pinged again on import.

item.title: Ticket #1768 (Massive Code Cleanup: template-functions-general.php and ...) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Part III of the Massive Code Cleanup series, taking on template-functions-general.php and template-functions-links.php

As before, the bulk of the work is:

  • spaces to tabs
  • two newlines between functions
  • brackets removed for one-line if ()s
  • \t\n => \n
  • [space]\n => \n
  • \t[space] => \t
  • no cramming two lines into one.
  • $id and $post declared global in function, when $post has $post->ID
  • if/else bracket tab matching
  • foreach : endforeach; and if : else; are for front-of-house code only
  • clean spacing for if, foreach, and for: if ( $condition ) {
  • if ( $something == 'value' ) => if ( 'value' == $something ) as per coding guidelines

item.title: Ticket #1767 (Admin form submissions with errors should re-populate form data) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
A good example of this is on the Users page. If one tries to add a user and forgets to put in an email address, an error is presented: "ERROR: please type an e-mail address", but the submitted form data is gone (nickname, first name, password, etc.).

All of the data that is submitted along with the form should be re-populated into the form fields in the case of an error.
